R package version 1.5.0, https://datashield.github.io/DSOpal/, https://www.obiba.org, https://www.obiba.org/pages/products/opal/, https://datashield.org/, https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/43/6/1929/707730, https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1008880, https://github.com/datashield/DSOpal/.

title: DataSHIELD Implementation for Opal
text: DataSHIELD Interface (DSI) implementation Opal data warehouse, based Opal R Client (opalr) package. reference implementation DataSHIELD Interface can used implementing data repository clients supporting DataSHIELD infrastructure. See usage examples. Articles Opal DataSHIELD: * DataSHIELD – New Directions Dimensions * DataSHIELD: taking analysis data, data analysis * Software Application Profile: Opal Mica: open-source software solutions epidemiological data management, harmonization dissemination

title: DSOpal: 'DataSHIELD' Implementation for 'Opal' — DSOpal-package
text: 'DataSHIELD' infrastructure series R packages enables remote 'non-disclosive' analysis sensitive research data. package 'DataSHIELD' interface implementation 'Opal', data integration application biobanks 'OBiBa'. Participant data, collected data source, must integrated stored central data repository uniform model. 'Opal' central repository. can import, process, validate, query, analyze, report, export data. 'Opal' reference implementation 'DataSHIELD' infrastructure.

title: DSOpal: 'DataSHIELD' Implementation for 'Opal' — DSOpal-package
text: Maintainer: Yannick Marcon yannick.marcon@obiba.org (ORCID) contributors: Becca Wilson (ORCID) [contributor] OBiBa group info@obiba.org [copyright holder]

title: Create a Opal driver — Opal

text: Opal driver implementing DataSHIELD Interface (DSI) DSDriver-class. class always initialized Opal function. returns singleton allows connect Opal.

title: Data aggregation — .datashield.aggregate
text: Aggregates expression result using specified aggregation method current Datashield session. operation asynchronous non blocking.

text: opal Opal object list opal objects. expr Expression evaluate. async Whether call asynchronous.

text: R command ID used retrieve command result (async) agregated value.

text: opal Opal object. symbol Name R symbol. value R expression allowed assign functions calls. async Whether call asynchronous.

text: R command ID async flag TRUE wait flag FALSE Opal version least 2.1, NULL otherwise.

text: R command ID async flag TRUE wait flag FALSE Opal version least 2.1, NULL otherwise.

title: Table data assignment — .datashield.assign.table
code: .datashield.assign.table(   opal,   symbol,   value,   variables = NULL,   missings = FALSE,   identifiers = NULL,   id.name = NULL,   tibble = FALSE,   async = TRUE )

title: Table data assignment — .datashield.assign.table
text: opal Opal object. symbol Name R symbol. value Fully qualified name variable table Opal. variables List variable names Javascript expression selects variables table (ignored value refere table). See javascript documentation: https://opaldoc.obiba.org/en/latest/magma-user-guide/methods.html missings TRUE, missing values pushed Opal R, default FALSE. Ignored value R expression. identifiers Name identifiers mapping use assigning entities R (Opal 2.0). id.name Name column contain entity identifiers. specified, identifiers data frame row names. specified column can used perform joins data frames. tibble Assign table tibble (tidyverse) instead plain data.frame. async Whether call asynchronous.

title: Table data assignment — .datashield.assign.table
text: R command ID async flag TRUE wait flag FALSE Opal version least 2.1, NULL otherwise.

Aggregate data — dsAggregate,OpalConnection-method
text: Aggregate data DataSHIELD R session using valid R expression. aggregation expression must satisfy data repository's DataSHIELD configuration.

title: Aggregate data — dsAggregate,OpalConnection-method
code: # S4 method for class 'OpalConnection' dsAggregate(conn, expr, async = TRUE)

title: Aggregate data — dsAggregate,OpalConnection-method
text: conn OpalConnection-class object. expr Expression evaluate. async Whether result call retrieved asynchronously. TRUE (default) calls parallelized connections, connection supports feature, extra overhead requests.

title: Aggregate data — dsAggregate,OpalConnection-method
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dbConnect(DSOpal::Opal(),    "administrator", "password", "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") dsAssignTable(con, "D", "test.CNSIM") dsAggregate(con, as.symbol("meanDS(D$WEIGHT)")) dsDisconnect(con) } # }

Ignored value R expression. identifiers Name identifiers mapping use assigning entities R (Opal 2.0). id.name Name column contain entity identifiers. specified, identifiers data frame row names. specified column can used perform joins data frames. async Whether result call retrieved asynchronously. TRUE (default) calls parallelized connections, connection supports feature, extra overhead requests.

what: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method
title: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method
text: Connect Opal server, provided credentials. create DataSHIELD R session, retrieves user profile.

title: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method
code: # S4 method for class 'OpalDriver' dsConnect(   drv,   name,   restore = NULL,   username = NULL,   password = NULL,   token = NULL,   url = NULL,   opts = list(),   profile = NULL,   ... )

title: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method
text: drv OpalDriver-class class object. name Name connection, must unique among DataSHIELD connections. restore Workspace name restored newly created DataSHIELD R session. username User name opal(s). password User password opal(s). token Personal access token (since opal 2.15, ignored username specified). url Opal url list opal urls. Can provided "opal.url" option. opts Curl options described httr (call httr::httr_options() details). Can provided "opal.opts" option. profile DataSHIELD R server profile (affects R packages available applied configuration). provided supported, default profile applied. ... Unused, needed compatibility generic.

title: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method
text: OpalConnection-class object.

title: Connect to a Opal server — dsConnect,OpalDriver-method

what: Disconnect from a Opal server — dsDisconnect,OpalConnection-method
title: Disconnect from a Opal server — dsDisconnect,OpalConnection-method
text: Disconnect Opal server release R resources. workspace ID provided, DataSHIELD R session saved destroyed.

title: Disconnect from a Opal server — dsDisconnect,OpalConnection-method
code: # S4 method for class 'OpalConnection' dsDisconnect(conn, save = NULL)

title: Disconnect from a Opal server — dsDisconnect,OpalConnection-method
text: conn OpalConnection-class class object save Save DataSHIELD R session provided ID (must character string).

title: Disconnect from a Opal server — dsDisconnect,OpalConnection-method
Fetch the result — dsFetch,OpalResult-method
text: Fetch DataSHIELD operation result.

title: Fetch the result — dsFetch,OpalResult-method
text: res OpalResult-class object.

title: Fetch the result — dsFetch,OpalResult-method
text: TRUE table exists.

title: Fetch the result — dsFetch,OpalResult-method
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dbConnect(DSOpal::Opal(), "server1",   "administrator", "password", "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") dsAssignExpr(con, "C", as.symbol("c(1, 2, 3)")) res <- dsAggregate(con, as.symbol("length(C)")) length <- dsFetch(res) dsDisconnect(con) } # }

text: Get information command (still available).

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dbConnect(DSOpal::Opal(), "server1",   "administrator", "password", "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") dsAssignExpr(con, "C", as.symbol("c(1, 2, 3)")) res <- dsAggregate(con, as.symbol("length(C)")) dsGetInfo(res) dsDisconnect(con) } # }

text: Get state remote R session return TRUE state RUNNING. Always TRUE synchronous operations.

title: Get whether the remote R session is up and running — dsIsReady,OpalSession-method
Get whether the remote R session is up and running — dsIsReady,OpalSession-method
text: session OpalSession-class object.

title: Get whether the remote R session is up and running — dsIsReady,OpalSession-method
text: logical indicating readiness session.

title: Get whether the remote R session is up and running — dsIsReady,OpalSession-method
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dbConnect(DSOpal::Opal(), "server1",   "administrator", "password", "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") session <- dsSession(con, async = TRUE) ready <- dsIsReady(session) while (!ready) {   Sys.sleep(1)   ready <- dsIsReady(session)   cat(".") } dsDisconnect(con) } # }

what: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
title: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
text: Create remote R session none exists. remote R session already exists, reused. Returns object class OpalSession-class representing remote R session accessible connection.

title: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
code: # S4 method for class 'OpalConnection' dsSession(conn, async = TRUE)

title: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
text: conn object inherits OpalConnection-class. async Whether result call retrieved asynchronously. TRUE (default) calls parallelized connections, connection supports feature, extra overhead requests.

title: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
text: object class OpalSession-class representing remote R session.

title: Create a remote R session — dsSession,OpalConnection-method
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dsConnect(DSOpal::Opal(), "server1",   username = "dsuser", password = "password", url = "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") session <- dsSession(con, async=TRUE) dsDisconnect(con) } # }

what: Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
title: Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
text: Explain remote R session state human-readable message.

title: Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
text: session OpalSession-class object.

title: Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
text: character string

title: Get the remote R session state message — dsStateMessage,OpalSession-method
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ con <- dbConnect(DSOpal::Opal(), "server1",   "administrator", "password", "https://opal-demo.obiba.org") session <- dsSession(con, async = TRUE) ready <- dsIsReady(session) while (!ready) {   Sys.sleep(1)   ready <- dsIsReady(session)   cat(dsStateMessage(session), "\n") } dsDisconnect(con) } # }

title: DataSHIELD login data file — logindata.opal.demo
text: DataSHIELD login data file based Opal demo server, CNSIM simulated data. CNSIM datasets contain synthetic data based model derived participants 1958 Birth Cohort, part obesity methodological development project. datasets contain NA values. Note Opal demo server rebuilt every day possibly accessible.

title: DataSHIELD login data file — logindata.opal.demo
text: https://opal-demo.obiba.org
